tableOfContents.text: How Can Your Business Leverage UPI
UPI Collections For Your Business - How can Decentro Help?

inlineImageAndParagraph.text: Decentro’s UPI Collections Stack enables businesses to accept payments via the Unified Payments Interface rails with full automation. By integrating Virtual Accounts, every transaction—whether via link, QR code, or collect request—is automatically tracked and reconciled in real-time, eliminating manual ledger matching and operational overhead.

inlineImageAndParagraph2.text: We provide a robust, multi-bank architecture that supports diverse payment flows suited for both online and offline models. From dynamic QR codes for retail to deep-links for app-based checkout, our infrastructure ensures high success rates and instant settlement confirmation through dedicated virtual accounts.

subheadings.title: Intent Flow & Deep Links
bulletPoints: Seamlessly triggers installed UPI apps (GPay, PhonePe) on the user's device for a friction-free payment experience.

subheadings.title: Dynamic QR Codes
bulletPoints: Generates machine-scannable, one-time use codes for immediate offline POS or web-based checkout transactions.

subheadings.title: Collect Request & TPV
bulletPoints: Initiates server-to-server payment requests and validates the source bank account for regulated sector compliance.

subBanner.text: Our stack handles millions of API calls daily, delivering 99.9% uptime and real-time settlement notifications to keep your cash flow moving instantly.

frequentlyAskedQuestions.solution: TPV allows you to restrict payments to a specific bank account linked to the user. If a payment is attempted from a non-registered account, Decentro's system automatically rejects it, ensuring compliance.

frequentlyAskedQuestions.query: What happens if a bank's UPI node is down?
frequentlyAskedQuestions.solution: Decentro's multi-bank architecture automatically routes transactions through an alternative banking partner to ensure your collection success rates remain high, minimizing the impact of bank downtime.
